channel.title: Clienty - A step forward to a perfect client
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/4GqR3rp.png[/img][/center] [hr]
[center][b][url=https://bitbucket.org/Artembatutin/clienty]Clienty Repository[/url][/b][/center]
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/tM6aFG4.png[/img][/center]
Sometimes, you look up around MoparScape, Rune-Server & Rune-Locus for a decent server. What do you expect to find? Stability? Content? Or maybe even both? Perhaps, people even search "clean stable pi" in Google. However, I'm not here to bring a server. I'm hear to bring a powerful client, Clienty! What is Clienty? Clienty will be a new huge client project that I'll bring to life. I hope to improve all aspects of a normal RSPS client by providing the following:
[ul][li]Great customizability.[/li] [li]Perfect looking, documented and organized code.[/li] [li]Packed cache without any preloading.[/li] [li]Several graphical systems that will make your server pop out.[/li] [li]A new client that will take the 'galkon ref' name away.[/li][/ul]
[b]Team:[/b] [ul][li]Poesy700[/li] [li]Artem Batutin[/li][/ul]
[b]Contributors(no order):[/b]
[ul][li]Josh(Galkon)[/li] [li]Rob(Bubletan)[/li][/ul]
You may ask any questions and those will be added here.
[b]Will this be released to the public in the download section?[/b] Yes.
[b]What data you'll be loading?[/b] 602 Revision data.

item.title: Clienty - A step forward to a perfect client
item.dc:creator: @Titanium1 Titanium_
item.description:
@Titanium1 wrote:

Best of luck Artem

Read full topic

That’s why I say 525/530 + HD = Sexy af.

item.title: Clienty - A step forward to a perfect client
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[quote=“Michael P, post:16, topic:541835”][quote author=artem543 link=topic=660705.msg4417395#msg4417395 date=1396567388]

it can’t have issues if you only supply the data with the correct header. (surely the only way to surpass the bugs would be to include multiple caches, and whichever cache is loaded, use the correct header.)

the only reason for this suggestion is because not everyone wants to have high revisioned data. of course if your client is user friendly then other users can port it to other revisions.

I’ll take your feedback in consideration. I might make it 474/602 if you insist.
[/quote]

What about normal 317…? :([/quote]

I like more the newer data. I just like the way it looks. You might have memories but I don’t. 474 is almost like 317 except the NPC’s/MOB’s.

[hr]
Update #2
[hr]

Dramaticaly decreased memory usage. It’s now between 61mb ~ 90mb. FPS is always 50.

Read full topic
item.source: Clienty - A step forward to a perfect client

it can’t have issues if you only supply the data with the correct header. (surely the only way to surpass the bugs would be to include multiple caches, and whichever cache is loaded, use the correct header.)

item.title: Clienty - A step forward to a perfect client
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[quote=“Michael P, post:12, topic:541835”]Why not use GitHub? Good luck though!

EDIT: [quote]Cache packed cache[/quote] Wat?[/quote]

My bad. I always hated GitHub. I prefer BitBucket

[hr]

[quote=“Vain_, post:11, topic:541835”]you won’t knock out josh just by releasing a client.

also, you should add support for multiple model headers, seeing as you like to incorporate multiple-revisioned content (aka gameframes, context menus, etc. etc)[/quote]

You’re right, i won’t knock out Josh. But I’ll still provide something to the community. And I don’t like having multiple data revisions as those may have issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Clienty - A step forward to a perfect client
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Er… the client was always perfect. The problem was always having a server not fully configured with the client, ie: packets missing, etc. Perfect client is more an “eye-of-the-beholder” type thing. Customization is key to a “perfect” client in the RSPS scene.

I agree with you in some way. However, client isn’t perfect from my opinion as MANY things can be improved.

Read full topic
item.source: Clienty - A step forward to a perfect client

}

Sometimes, you look up around MoparScape, Rune-Server & Rune-Locus for a decent server. What do you expect to find? Stability? Content? Or maybe even both? Perhaps, people even search “clean stable pi” in Google. However, I’m not here to bring a server. I’m hear to bring a powerful client, Clienty! What is Clienty?
